job.title: Data Scientist
job.description:
Artifact is looking for data scientists and NLP researchers at various skill levels to join our growing team.
Key ML Focus Areas
Natural language processing
Natural language understanding
Knowledge Graphs and Graph Neural Networks
What You'll Be Doing
By using massive amounts of historical and realtime qualitative data, you will help research, develop and automate models for semantic understanding, text similarities, clustering, sentiment and emotion, and expressive summarization.
One example: Build / Enhance our end-to-end solution that analyzes historical customer conversations and answers user questions as a summarized insight. Beyond answering, allow the user to facet and pivot the data while updating the summary insight dynamically.
Work with product management and design roles to understand and empathize with end customer needs.
Build end-to-end ML solutions spanning from data access (SQL) to model endpoint (API / batch service) and deploy to cloud based staging environments (Kubernetes on GCP) by collaborating with software engineers.
Collaborate with our academic partners and research new ML techniques / enhancements and publish blogs or journal / conference papers.
Open source code or software that will benefit the larger community of ML practitioners.
Ideal Candidate
Has solid fundamentals in approaching and solving ML / DS problems. Think: "data source", "data lineage", "data transformation", "data age and relevance", "model consumption", "post consumption action" etc.
Leans towards action and experimentation with a priority towards rapid prototyping.
Approaches problems from a first principles mindset and question assumptions.
Has dived deep and spent a good amount of time solving "one" ML problem.
Is naturally curious and willing to take a step to learn something they don’t have experience in.
Has experience with SQL, Python, NLTK or Spacy or other NLP libraries, PyTorch or JAX or TensorFlow. DGL and data visualization experience is a plus.
Experience Bonus
Masters Degree or PhD in Computational Linguistics, Engineering, Statistics or related field
Previous experience/education in syntax, semantics and morphology
Experience with semantic understanding and summarization of short phrases across a heterogenous corpus.
Experience collaborating with software development teams, data scientists, business intelligence or other technical roles
Company Benefits
No-cost insurance premiums: We cover the cost of your medical, dental, and vision insurance premiums.
Flexible insurance options: We offer EPO, POS, FSA plans, and HDHP coverage for you to choose from. Everyone’s situation is different.
401k plan: We want you to be physically, emotionally, and financially secure.
Corporate expense card: Every employee gets a corporate expense card to use, because you’re an adult. (Unless you’re a child prodigy, and then we’ll talk about it.)
Brand new equipment: We’ll pay for your work equipment and machines.
Flexible work environment: We’re a distributed company. We know schedules and environments are different for everyone. We don’t hold office hours, we just trust you’ll make appropriate agreements with your team.
Monthly activity: Expense up to $100 each month on activities (dinner, movie, skiing, boating, golfing, etc.)
Office snack: Expense up to $25 each month on snacks for your home office.
Library card: Expense your Audible Premium membership or spend up to $15 each month on books.
Cell phone reimbursement: Expense up to $100 each month on your phone bill.
